#Text=Randall Munroe , writer of xkcd , talks about the comic , politics and the internet
#Text=Tuesday , March 4 , 2008
#Text=Randall Munroe is the writer of the popular webcomic xkcd .
#Text=The comic is known for its geeky humor and minimalist drawing style that generally uses stick figures .
#Text=Munroe worked as a contractor for NASA before writing xkcd full time in 2006 .
#Text=Wikinews reporter Joshua Zelinsky interviewed Munroe at Vericon , Harvard 's annual science fiction convention .
#Text=Interview with Randall Munroe
#Text=So could you tell us a little about yourself and xkcd ?

#Text=RM : xkcd is a webcomic that I started while I was in the middle of more productive things , school and work , that sort of by accident turned into a big thing and eventually became what I did professionally .
#Text=I quit my job and got out of school and started drawing pictures on the internet .
#Text=A lot of math and computer people like it , science people .
#Text=It 's sort of nerdy in general .
#Text=So , you have a somewhat non-standard style rule for typing out " xkcd " which I know has caused great consternation on Wikipedia and elsewhere .
#Text=RM :
#Text=Well , the first thing is , it started off as a screename and an irc nick , where I ’m very used to seeing it all lowercase .
#Text=There are a lot of trendy things , from e. e. cummings , the poet , up through businesses that take that sort of thing .
#Text=It is a big problem for starting sentences .
#Text=If you want to start a sentence with “ xkcd ” it seems very wrong not to capitalize it .
#Text=But I really grew to dislike capital X , lower case “ kcd ” because that made it seem like a word or a name more than a string of letters .
#Text=The whole purpose is that it is a really abstract string .
#Text=Capitalizing it is sort of saying something about it .
#Text=If you ’re used to treating abstract strings in programming , changing case is not a trivial thing .
#Text=It 's changing what the string is .
#Text=So when it is in its canonical form , that ’s the real xkcd , the other forms look wrong to me .
#Text=So but on the other hand , I try not to make things too hard on people so I say “ ok , all lower case is preferred if you want to capitalize , I prefer all caps .
#Text=Mixed case is my third and least favorite choice ” But to some extent that ’s just style .
#Text=Not for any particularly important reason .
#Text=The comic
#Text=When did you realize you had a genuinely successful webcomic ?
#Text=RM :

#Text=When it first started out there was a brief flurry of people when Cory Doctorow linked to me with Boing Boing and it had only been up for a couple of weeks then , but “ whoa there are lot of people reading this .
#Text=This is a cool feeling .
#Text=I like .
#Text=It 's neat seeing so many people respond and laughing and it makes me want to write more ” .
#Text=That was really the turning point so then I did it for a little while .
#Text=I stopped for that winter , 2005-2006 , and then started doing it again , and at that point I was picking up readers gradually .
#Text=It was continual slow , sort of exponential climb .
#Text=And from then on , it was just a matter of ok , we ’ve hit a hundred readers a day , ok we ’ve hit 500 .
#Text=and then a thousand .
#Text=And at some I , you know , realized “ whoa this is a lot of people . ”
#Text=But it sort of sneaks up on you .
